Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Injury.Injury_with_annotation: By the day after the wreck, rescue boats and helicopters found seven people, one of whom later died from their injuries.

Main_Event_Assessment_With_Annotation: Hurricane How: Hurricane How was the only tropical cyclone to make landfall on the United States in 1951. It was the eighth storm of the season, forming on September 28 in the northwest Caribbean and, after entering the Gulf of Mexico, turned eastward and became a tropical storm. The storm brought heavy rainfall to Florida, causing flooding and $2 million in damage. Tropical Storm How later became a hurricane, passing near the Outer Banks of North Carolina where it produced strong winds and high tides.

Total_Summary_Death.Total_Death_Annotation: Ultimately, 17 people died in the event.

Total_Death_Per_Country.Death_with_annotation: Offshore, a ship called Southern Isle was wrecked by the high surf... By the day after the wreck, rescue boats and helicopters found seven people, one of whom later died from their injuries. Ultimately, 17 people died in the event.

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Insured_Da.Insured_Damage_Assessment_with_annotatio: The storm brought heavy rainfall to Florida, causing flooding and $2 million in damage.

Location_with_Annotation.Florida: The storm brought heavy rainfall to Florida, causing flooding and $2 million in damage.
Location_with_Annotation.Outer Banks: Hurricane How reached peak winds of 100 mph (160 km/h) on October 4 as it passed near the Outer Banks of North Carolina.
Location_with_Annotation.Virginia: Hurricane How produced 50 mph (80 km/h) winds and high tides along the Outer Banks and southeastern Virginia.
Location_with_Annotation.New England: Rains and high tides occurred in southeastern New England, before the hurricane moved out to sea and became extratropical.
Location_with_Annotation.Miami: Miami reported a gust of 60 mph (97 km/h).
Location_with_Annotation.West Palm Beach: West Palm Beach reported 55 mph (89 km/h) winds.
Location_with_Annotation.Bonita Springs: The highest total was 15.7 inches (40 cm) near Bonita Springs, near where it moved ashore.
Location_with_Annotation.Fort Myers: Elsewhere, Fort Myers reported 10.43 inches (26.5 cm).
Location_with_Annotation.Clewiston: Clewiston along the western shore of Lake Okeechobee received about 10 inches (25 cm).
Location_with_Annotation.Lake Okeechobee: Clewiston along the western shore of Lake Okeechobee received about 10 inches (25 cm); the lake rose about 4 inches (10 cm) from the rainfall, but no overflow was expected.
Location_with_Annotation.Cape Hatteras: Hurricane warnings were posted from Cape Hatteras to Manteo, and ships were advised to remain at port.
Location_with_Annotation.Manteo: Hurricane warnings were posted from Cape Hatteras to Manteo, and ships were advised to remain at port.
Location_with_Annotation.Block Island: In New England, the Weather Bureau issued storm warnings from Block Island, Rhode Island to Portland, Maine, with rains, fog, and heavy surf reported.
Location_with_Annotation.Portland: In New England, the Weather Bureau issued storm warnings from Block Island, Rhode Island to Portland, Maine, with rains, fog, and heavy surf reported.
Location_with_Annotation.Massachusetts: Several roads were closed in Massachusetts due to the tides.

Total_Summary_Damage.Total_Economic_Damage_Assessment_with_an: Overall, Hurricane How caused about $2 million (USD) in damage.

Total_Economic_Damage_Per_Country.Total_Economic_Damage_Assessment_with_an: Overall, Hurricane How caused about $2 million (USD) in damage.

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Economic_D.Economic_Damage_Assessment_with_annotati: The storm brought heavy rainfall to Florida, causing flooding and $2 million in damage.

Perils_Assessment_With_Annotation.Wind: Miami reported a gust of 60 mph (97 km/h), and West Palm Beach reported 55 mph (89 km/h) winds.
Perils_Assessment_With_Annotation.Rainfall: Nevertheless, heavy rainfall occurred along its path. The highest total was 15.7 inches (40 cm) near Bonita Springs, near where it moved ashore.
Perils_Assessment_With_Annotation.Flood: Elsewhere, the precipitation caused some significant street flooding, while about 7,000 acres (28 km2) of tomato and bean fields were deluged.
Perils_Assessment_With_Annotation.Landfall: The storm strengthened to just below hurricane force, making landfall near Punta Gorda, Florida with 70 mph (110 km/h) winds (115 km/h).

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Building_D.Building_Damage_with_annotation: Miami reported a gust of 60 mph (97 km/h), and West Palm Beach reported 55 mph (89 km/h) winds. Wind damage was minor, confined to a few broken windows and the sinking or damaging of some small craft.

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Affected.Affected_with_annotation: A ship called the 'Southern Isles' capsized off Cape Hatteras, killing 17 out of the crew of 23.
